column1: Koryazhma (Russian: Коря́жма) is a town in the southeast of Arkhangelsk Oblast
column3: located on the left bank of the Vychegda River 30 kilometers (19 mi) east of Kotlas
column4: at the confluence of the Bolshaya Koryazhemka River. Population: 39

column1: == History ==

column2: the Koryazhemsky Nikolaevsky Monastery was founded in the mouth of the Bolshaya Koryazhemka (hence the name). After the 1917 October Revolution the monastery was abolished
column3: and the territories which previously belonged to the monastery were used for agriculture. In 1953
column4: the construction of a big paper mill started
column5: and in 1954 first brickstone houses were built. In 1957
column6: the settlement around the paper mill was officially designated as the urban-type settlement of Koryazhma. The paper mill started operation in 1961. In 1975
column7: the population of Koryazhma was 42 thousands. August 15
column9: Koryazhma obtained the town rights and became the town of oblast significance.

column1: == Administrative and municipal status ==
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the town of oblast significance of Koryazhma—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the town of oblast significance of Koryazhma is incorporated as Koryazhma Urban Okrug.Even though Koryazhma is not a part of Kotlassky District (by which it is geographically surrounded)
column4: it serves as the administrative center of Koryazhemsky Selsoviet
column5: one of the twelve selsoviets into which that district is divided.

column1: == Economy ==
=== Industry ===
Koryazhma is home of the Koryazhma Branch of the Ilim Group company
column2: the largest chemical pulp and paper mills in Europe (previously Kotlas Pulp and Paper Mill).

column1: === Transportation ===
The Vychegda in Koryazhma is navigable
column2: and in summer there is regular passenger navigation connecting Kotlas and Soyga (located approximately halfway between Koryazhma and Yarensk).

column1: There is a railway station (Nizovka) on the line connecting Kotlas and Vorkuta.
Koryazhma is located on the road connecting Kotlas and Syktyvkar (via Shiroky Priluk). This portion of the road is paved. There is regular passenger bus traffic from Koryazhma to Kotlas
== Culture and recreation ==

The only collection of historical buildings in Koryazhma is in the Koryazhemsky Nikolaevsky Monastery. The Church of the Holy Mandylion originates from 1746 and is one of the oldest stone churches in Arkhangelsk Oblast
column2: and the Church of Saint Longin of Koryazhma
column3: consecrated to the founder of the monastery
column4: was built between 1907 and 1912. There is also the House of the Hegumen which forms a single ensemble with the Church of Saint Longin of Koryazhma. All these buildings are protected as cultural heritage of local importance. The Annunciation Cathedral
column5: the oldest stone building of the monastery (1665)

column1: === Sports ===
The local association football team is FC Khimik Koryazhma.
There is also a bandy team
